abstract: Pentagon announces nomination of Lt Gen Robert B Neller as commandant of Marine Corps, ending nearly two months of uncertainty over who would lead the force as it prepares for the prospect of opening combat roles to women.
lead_paragraph: A veteran infantry officer who has served in Iraq, General Neller, 62, if confirmed, would succeed Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr., named as the next chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

headline.main: Lt. Gen. Robert Neller Nominated to Lead the Marines
headline.print_headline: National Briefing | Washington; Marine Corps Leader Nominated

snippet: A veteran infantry officer who has served in Iraq, General Neller, 62, if confirmed, would succeed Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr., named as the next chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
